str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and erchomai; to supervene, i.e. Arrive, occur, impend, attack, influence.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To show forth, prove. From en and deiknuo; to indicate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To surpass, excel, exceed, transcend. From huper and ballo; to throw beyod the usual mark, i.e. to surpass.
From the base of pletho; wealth, i.e. money, possessions, or abundance, richness, valuable bestowment.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Goodness, uprightness, kindness, gentleness. From chrestos; usefulness, i.e. Morally, excellence.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
